newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash soymeal - Most basis offers stay flat.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash soymeal - Most basis offers stay flat.

text.p: Most rail and truck soymeal offers were unchanged Thursday in lackluster trading as Wednesday's sharp gains discouraged buyers from new purchases, soymeal brokers said.
"Meal demand has been stifled by the board jumping around here like it has," said one Indiana-based dealer.
On Wednesday, nearby CBOT soymeal futures rallied more than half the $10.00 per tonne trading limit, and March soymeal was trading slightly higher again early Thursday.
The National Oilseed Processors Association will release weekly crushing data Thursday afternoon.
Market watchers expect the crush to range from 29.5 million to 30.3 million bushels.
"I'm not sensing any serious slowdown here in the crush," one Midwestern broker said.
Spot rail soymeal (dollars/ton basis CBOT, 47.5 pct protein): Chicago +14.00 + H - unc
Spot truck soymeal basis (dollars per ton):
